thread.title: Petratos set for return to Brisbane
thread.title_full: Petratos set for return to Brisbane

title: Petratos set for return to Brisbane
text:
Oscar secures Wanderers clash 
HOW DID ROAR SINK THE CHINESE GIANT? 
Flying in the face of predictions the Chinese Super League’s star power would be too much to handle, Brisbane’s Brandon Borrello and Tommy Oar combined to score first-half goals and stun the hosts before their disciplined midfield and defence shut out Shenhua as they pushed for a way back into the match. 
The goalscorers, in combination with Jamie Maclaren, formed a pacy and exciting front three; while Thomas Kristensen and Thomas Broich were great in midfielder - though the veteran began to tire towards the end of the match. 
However, according to former Wanderers and Perth Glory goalkeeper Ante Covic, Oar had his “best game in a very, very long time.” Tommy Oar-chestrates stunner 0:40 
ACL: Tommy Oar has given the Brisbane Roar a two goal lead over Shanghai Shenhua with his stunner. February 8th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/Asian Champions League/ Tommy Oar-chestrates stunner 
Fox Sports commentator Ned Zelic added: “He’s always had potential... what’s impressed me from his game is just that he works so hard for the team to get back and defend. He’s a tremendous attacking player.” 
“If you didn’t see Brisbane’s win over Tevez and co, it was no fluke,” wrote Fox Sports’ Adam Peacock on Twitter. 
The victory is made all the more impressive by the fact the Roar battled out a goalless draw against the undefeated Sydney FC on Friday night and had to endure almost freezing conditions in Shanghai. 
But their manager wasn’t surprised by the victory. If you didn't see Brisbane's win over Tevez and co, it was no fluke.Top away display, in words of Rocky to Clubber Lang "you ain't so bad" — Adam Peacock (@adampeacock3) February 8, 2017 
ALOISI: DON’T UNDERESTIMATE ROAR 
John Aloisi hailed the boilover in China as the greatest victory in his tenure at the club. 
Considering the travel, opponent, change in conditions and hostile crowd at the Hongkou Stadium, Aloisi rated it as his proudest victory. 
“Since I’ve been up been here, that’s probably been the biggest win - especially because a lot of people really didn’t give us a chance of beating them,” Aloisi said. 
“But we showed we’re not only a good footballing team but we can also fight when we have to and defend. 
“I wouldn’t say that money’s overrated - I’d say that people shouldn’t underestimate the culture we’ve got at Brisbane Roar. 
“We’ve shown that time and time again. Aloisi: We aren't surprised 0:32 
Football: Well Brisbane Roar have confirmed their place in the Asian Champions League Group Stage... after upsetting Shanghai ShenWa. February 9th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/sourceId/607595/ Aloisi: We aren't surprised 
“It was a brilliant result - a tough game, but bloody hell, it was an unbelievable atmosphere, and a really good performance.” 
Fox Sports commentator Mark Rudan added that it’s a “momentous” occasion for Australian football. 
Brisbane have been to the Champions League twice before but never made it past the group stages. 
“The players that have been in there before are excited. Matty McKay especially, he was one of the happiest after the game because he wants that opportunity,” Aloisi said. 'The miss of an eternity' 1:04 
Football: Highlights from the ACL. February 9th 2017
